property.name: dfs.ha.namenodes.mycluster
property.description:
The prefix for a given nameservice, contains a comma-separated list of namenodes for a given nameservice (eg EXAMPLENAMESERVICE).
Unique identifiers for each NameNode in the nameservice, delimited by commas. This will be used by DataNodes to determine all the NameNodes in the cluster. For example, if you used “mycluster” as the nameservice ID previously, and you wanted to use “nn1” and “nn2” as the individual IDs of the NameNodes, you would configure a property dfs.ha.namenodes.mycluster, and its value "nn1,nn2".

property.name: dfs.namenode.rpc-address.mycluster.nn1
property.description: RPC address that handles all clients requests. In the case of HA/Federation where multiple namenodes exist, the name service id is added to the name e.g. dfs.namenode.rpc-address.ns1 dfs.namenode.rpc-address.EXAMPLENAMESERVICE The value of this property will take the form of nn-host1:rpc-port. The NameNode's default RPC port is 8020.

property.name: dfs.namenode.rpc-address.mycluster.nn2
property.description: RPC address that handles all clients requests. In the case of HA/Federation where multiple namenodes exist, the name service id is added to the name e.g. dfs.namenode.rpc-address.ns1 dfs.namenode.rpc-address.EXAMPLENAMESERVICE The value of this property will take the form of nn-host1:rpc-port. The NameNode's default RPC port is 8020.

property.name: dfs.namenode.http-address.mycluster.nn1
property.description: The address and the base port where the dfs namenode web ui will listen on.

property.name: dfs.namenode.http-address.mycluster.nn2
property.description: The address and the base port where the dfs namenode web ui will listen on.

property.name: dfs.namenode.shared.edits.dir
property.description: A directory on shared storage between the multiple namenodes in an HA cluster. This directory will be written by the active and read by the standby in order to keep the namespaces synchronized. This directory does not need to be listed in dfs.namenode.edits.dir above. It should be left empty in a non-HA cluster.

property.name: dfs.client.failover.proxy.provider.mycluster
property.description: The prefix (plus a required nameservice ID) for the class name of the configured Failover proxy provider for the host. For more detailed information, please consult the "Configuration Details" section of the HDFS High Availability documentation.

property.name: dfs.ha.fencing.methods
property.description: A list of scripts or Java classes which will be used to fence the Active NameNode during a failover. See the HDFS High Availability documentation for details on automatic HA configuration.

property.name: dfs.journalnode.edits.dir
property.description: The directory where the journal edit files are stored.

property.name: dfs.ha.automatic-failover.enabled
property.description: Whether automatic failover is enabled. See the HDFS High Availability documentation for details on automatic HA configuration.
